trans-unit.source: Fills rectangle or triangle gradient
Parameters
Handle to the device context.
The 2D array ([x1, y1, $iRGB1], [x2, y2, $iRGB2], ... [xN, yN, $iRGBN]) that contains the necessary
gradient vertices. Each vertex in this array contains the following parameters.

seg-source.mrk: Each vertex in this array contains the following parameters.

target.mrk: Each vertex in this array contains the following parameters.

trans-unit.source: x - The x-coordinate, in logical units.

seg-source.mrk: x - The x-coordinate, in logical units.

target.mrk: x - The x-coordinate, in logical units.

trans-unit.source: y - The y-coordinate, in logical units

seg-source.mrk: y - The y-coordinate, in logical units

target.mrk: y - The y-coordinate, in logical units

trans-unit.source: rgb - The color information at the point of x, y.

seg-source.mrk: rgb - The color information at the point of x, y.

target.mrk: rgb - The color information at the point of x, y.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The index of array to start filling at.

seg-source.mrk: The index of array to start filling at.

target.mrk: The index of array to start filling at.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The index of array to stop filling at.

seg-source.mrk: The index of array to stop filling at.

target.mrk: The index of array to stop filling at.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether fills a rectangle from left to right edge (horizontal gradient).

seg-source.mrk: Specifies whether fills a rectangle from left to right edge (horizontal gradient).

target.mrk: Specifies whether fills a rectangle from left to right edge (horizontal gradient).

trans-unit.source: $bRotate used only for the rectangular gradients, for the triangular gradients this parameter will be ignored,

seg-source.mrk: $bRotate used only for the rectangular gradients, for the triangular gradients this parameter will be ignored,

target.mrk: $bRotate used only for the rectangular gradients, for the triangular gradients this parameter will be ignored,

trans-unit.source: valid values:
True - Fills from left to right edge.

seg-source.mrk: True - Fills from left to right edge.

target.mrk: True - Fills from left to right edge.

trans-unit.source: False - Fills from top to bottom edge (Default).

seg-source.mrk: False - Fills from top to bottom edge (Default).

target.mrk: False - Fills from top to bottom edge (Default).

trans-unit.source: Return Value
Remarks
If the number of vertices defined by using $iStart and $iEnd parameters is 2, _WinAPI_GradientFill() function

seg-source.mrk: If the number of vertices defined by using $iStart and $iEnd parameters is 2, _WinAPI_GradientFill() function

target.mrk: If the number of vertices defined by using $iStart and $iEnd parameters is 2, _WinAPI_GradientFill() function

trans-unit.source: fills a rectangle. If the number of vertices is 3, fills a triangle. For the rectangle, the vertices must

seg-source.mrk: If the number of vertices is 3, fills a triangle.
For the rectangle, the vertices must

target.mrk: If the number of vertices is 3, fills a triangle.
For the rectangle, the vertices must

trans-unit.source: specify its upper left and lower right corners. Note that $aVertex array may contain any number of vertices

seg-source.mrk: specify its upper left and lower right corners.
Note that $aVertex array may contain any number of vertices

target.mrk: specify its upper left and lower right corners.
Note that $aVertex array may contain any number of vertices

trans-unit.source: of the gradient, but only 2 or 3 vertices may be used at the same time from this array.

seg-source.mrk: of the gradient, but only 2 or 3 vertices may be used at the same time from this array.

target.mrk: of the gradient, but only 2 or 3 vertices may be used at the same time from this array.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the function is fails.
_WinAPI_GradientFill() function can only fill the rectangle or triangle at one call. Use multiple calls this

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_GradientFill() function can only fill the rectangle or triangle at one call.

target.mrk: _WinAPI_GradientFill() function can only fill the rectangle or triangle at one call.
